alert.note: Alert for Banner; Scotts Bluff (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 10 at 12:49AM CDT until May 10 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Banner County in the panhandle of Nebraska... Central Scotts Bluff County in the panhandle of Nebraska... * Until 300 AM MDT. * At 1149 PM MDT, trained weather spotters reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Scottsbluff, Gering, Terrytown, Minatare, Scotts Bluff National Monument, Hubbard Hill, Wildcat Hills Campground, Wildcat Hills State Recreation Area, Scottsbluff Airport, Lake Minatare Campground, Lake Minatare and Melbeta. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
